title: Osservatorio degli italianismi nel mondo (OIM) – a digital resource for surveying Italian loanwords in the world's languages
segmentation: Hello everybody, so I'm glad to speak and describe about and describe this ongoing lexicographical project.
The Osservatorio della Italian is mineral mondo, so it's an Observatory on Italianism's Italian loanwords in the languages of the world.
It's a digital resource and it's made to survey the impact of Italian loan words in the lexicon of.
As I said, the world's languages.
That is, the languages that we know about to have loan words which are quite a few Italian loanwords in them.

On this kind of phenomena and has been corroborated by subsequent studies.
As for the notion of italianism, that is the imitation of an Italian linguistic pattern by another speech community.
There is a lot of reference literature, so I won't go into details.
Italian isms and borrowings in general can mean rather diverse elements like the following.
I just give a few examples if you haven't.

Sense of training.

Not documented, not registered in town lexicography like the German Pico Bell Law.
Or you might even have proverbial phrases like it, Percy, Marvin, French and English.
